business.headline: Government to continue footing the bill for UPI payments under Rs 2,000The scheme covers transactions up to Rs 2,000 and will be in place for one year, from April 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025.
India's first Trump-branded office project to be built in Pune. Check detailsOver the past decade, India has emerged as the largest international market for Trump-branded real estate.

Sensex, Nifty extend positive streak, but IT and FMCG stocks limit market gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 147.79 points to settle at 75,449.05, while the NSE Nifty50 added 73.30 points to close at 22,907.60.

REC shares rise after board clears 4th interim dividend for FY25. Check detailsREC Dividend: The company announced a dividend payout of Rs 3.6 per share, taking the total dividend declared so far in FY25 to Rs 15.4 per share.

Zomato shares surge over 4% as rally continues for 2nd day. What next?At 12:50 pm, shares of Zomato were up 4.12% to Rs 227.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It may be noted that Zomato shares are rising despite the possibility that it could face an old insolvency plea.

PhysicsWallah IPO: Edtech firm files for Rs 4,600 crore public listingPhysicsWallah IPO: The edtech company has taken the confidential pre-filing route, a method that allows companies to submit their IPO documents to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) without making financial details public immediately.

SAIL shares jump 4% today as steel stocks gain. Should you buy?SAIL shares gained 4% during the intraday trading session, following a broad-based rally in steel stock prices. Read to find out if the company's stock is likely to gain further.

Missed Rs 5,000 SIP in top Nifty stocks 5 years ago? Returns may surprise youDespite the recent correction, a systematic investment plan (SIP) in top Nifty50 stocks over the past five years would have still delivered strong returns.

TCS, Infosys, HCLTech: Why major IT stocks are falling todayShares of TCS and Infosys dropped 2%, while other IT names like HCLTech, Tech Mahindra, LTIMindtree, and Coforge also traded in the red. The Nifty IT index, which had been gaining for the last three sessions, was the worst-performing sectoral index in morning trade.

Mishra Dhatu Nigam shares jump 7%. Why is defence PSU stock rising today?Mishra Dhatu Nigam stock price: At 10:36 am, Mishra Dhatu Nigam shares traded 6.27% higher at Rs 279 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Hero MotoCorp sees mass exits, key senior executives step down: ReportNearly half a dozen top executives are believed to have stepped down in the past few days, with more exits likely in the coming weeks.

Vodafone Idea shares jump 4% after 5G launch in Mumbai. Check key detailsVodafone Idea share price today: Shares of the telecom company gained sharply during early trade after it announced the launch of 5G services in Mumbai.

entertainment.headline: Sky Force on OTT: When and where to watch the Akshay Kumar, Veer Pahariya filmSky Force, featuring Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya, is set to stream on Prime Video from March 21. The film, inspired by true events, explores themes of camaraderie, sacrifice, and patriotism.

Meet Amrapali Shindhe, Bengaluru artiste who brought Kannada soul to LollapaloozaAmrapali Shindhe, a Bengaluru-based artiste, made a significant impact at Lollapalooza 2025 by performing in multiple languages, including Kannada, amid a predominantly English and Hindi lineup. Her performance was not just about music but a statement of cultural pride and linguistic representation.

Param Singh on Ghum Hai...: Thought I might not be able to pull off Dr NeilActor Param Singh returned to television with a new role in Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin, marking a shift from his usual intense characters to the calm and composed persona of Dr Neil. In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, he spoke about his initial nervousness and excitement about the opportunity and his focus on performing with honesty.

Anurag Kashyap 'frustrated' by 'morally corrupt' Netflix India, praises AdolescenceAnurag Kashyap has openly criticised Netflix's approach towards Indian content, calling it hypocritical. He praised the British series Adolescence, expressing envy over its daring storytelling.

Fe3O4 FORWARD album review: NMIXX's most ambitious release yetNMIXX pushes boundaries with their latest EP Fe3O4 FORWARD. Featuring a mix of genres and a collaboration with Indian choreographer Paramdeep Singh, the album showcases the group's evolution and daring creativity.

Sylvester Stallone's Tulsa King renewed for third seasonTulsa King fans rejoice as the hit crime drama gets the green light for a third season. The series, featuring Sylvester Stallone, has captivated with its gripping storyline and stellar cast.

Kanye West hits back at Playboi Carti's request to collaborate with daughter NorthRapper Kanye West was displeased with fellow rapper Playboi Carti's request to collaborate with his daughter, North West. He voiced his disapproval and reaffirmed his parental authority in a series of posts on X.

Kim Soo-hyun releases new statement on Kim Sae-ron row, denies any wrongdoingKorean star Kim Soo-hyun's team has released a new statement amid the ongoing controversy regarding his alleged involvement in actor Kim Sae-ron's death.

Pakistani actor Danish Taimoor invokes internet's wrath for comments on polygamyPakistani actor Danish Taimoor's recent comments on Islam and polygamy have upset the internet. His controversial take on the concept of having multiple wives has been gathering heat on social media.

Exclusive: Lex Scott Davis on Suits LA, comparisons with original, Harvey's cameoIn Suits LA, Lex Scott Davis plays the role of Erica, a confident woman in a male-dominated world. In an interview with us, Davis teases about Harvey Specter's return to the Suits world.

Suits LA: Harvey Specter is here, but what does his entry bring to the table?Suits LA Episode 4: Harvey Specter has entered the show. However, he is still not on the West Coast yet. How will this new twist bring more excitement to Aaron Korsh's spin-off?

Dupahiya director Sonam Nair on heartland stories, comparison with PanchayatDupahiya director Sonam Nair opens up about the setting of the Prime Video show, comparisons with Panchayat and more in an exclusive interaction.

Kanneda star Parmish Verma on the 'incident' that turned his life upside downActor-singer Parmish Verma spoke to India Today about the real meaning of success, his show, 'Kanneda', and the difficult time in his life when he had to re-set everything. Verma said he started looking at his life in a new light.

Shekhar Kapur slams OTT for Bandit Queen's edits: No one asked meFilmmaker Shekhar Kapur recently criticised his film, Bandit Queen's OTT edits. Shekhar wrote about how Indian filmmakers are no less than Western directors.

Jeet Adani on joining Shark Tank India: Don't want to change just 1–2 livesJeet Adani will join Shark Tank India as a mentor for the Devang Special week, focusing on businesses by differently-abled entrepreneurs. He will be joined by the visually impaired entrepreneur Srikanth Bolla.

Pankaj Tripathi says he's 'proud' as daughter Aashi makes debut in music videoPankaj Tripathi's daughter Aashi debuts in the music video Rang Daaro. The music video left her parents emotional. Pankaj called it a proud moment as Aashi began her acting journey.

Rapper Hanumankind meets 'GOAT' Virat Kohli at RCB unbox event. See picRapper Hanumankind recently met Virat Kohli at the RCB unbox event at the Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. The rapper shared a picture from the special moment on social media.

Adolescence: Why everyone's talking about this mini-series on NetflixNetflix's Adolescence is earning rave reviews for its gripping one-shot storytelling and stellar performances. Critics and filmmakers like Hansal Mehta call it "next-level storytelling."

iHeartRadio Music Awards 2025: Taylor Swift dominates, Lady Gaga earns honourThe 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards celebrated top artistes, with Taylor Swift dominating the voted categories. Lady Gaga received a special honour, adding to the night's excitement.

general news.headline: Doesn't deserve to live: Father of Meerut woman who killed husband says hang herThe father of the Meerut woman, who along with her lover, are accused of killing her husband and hiding his chopped body in a cement-filled drum, said she could not live without drugs and wanted to get rid of him.

Farmer leaders Jagjit Dallewal, Sarwan Pandher detained by cops in MohaliThe Punjab Police detained farmer leaders Jagjit Singh Dallewal and Sarwan Singh Pandher in Mohali as a group of farmers clashed with them while trying to march to the Shambhu and Khanauri borders for the ongoing farmers' protest.

India calls for sustained humanitarian aid, hostages' release after Gaza bombingIndia expressed concern over the situation in Gaza, where deadly Israeli airstrikes killed over 400 people, and said the supply of humanitarian assistance to the people there should be sustained.

Nagpur riots mastermind Fahim Khan arrested, caught on camera spreading rumoursPolice have named Fahim Khan as the mastermind of the Nagpur violence, alleging that his inflammatory speech triggered the clashes, leaving several injured and sparking large-scale unrest.
Ghost Aurangzeb and move onHow do we deal with a man who died three centuries ago, but won't stop kicking?

Chahal complied with divorce consent terms: High Court on Rs 4.75 crore alimonyThe Bombay High Court overturned a family court decision that denied the request to waive the statutory cooling-off period for the divorce of cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma. It directed the family court to decide the divorce petition by Thursday, March 20.

US faces housing crisis. Why Elon Musk's DOGE is to blameThe US is staring at a housing crisis after Elon Musk's DOGE halted federal housing projects, cutting $30 million in grants, worsening affordability, and stalling 1,000+ programs.

Sunita Williams's space marathon ends: Back home after 286 daysSunita Williams return: The astronauts, part of the Crew-9 mission, ended their spaceflight as they splashed down in the Atlantic Ocean having braved the challenging re-entry through Earth's atmosphere.

Did CIA have a role in John Kennedy's murder? Explosive details in JFK filesJFK Files: Former US President John Kennedy was assassinated in 1963 as his motorcade was passing through Dallas. The JFK files released by the Trump administration indicate that the CIA might have neglected red flags.

Will leave Rahul Gandhi red-faced: BJP as Shashi Tharoor praises PM Modi againPraising PM Modi for his diplomatic strategies for the second time in a month, Shashi Tharoor admitted he was wrong in opposing India's stand on the Ukraine war.

Aurangzeb not relevant today: RSS's big remark after Nagpur violence, tomb rowNagpur violence: Over 30 people were injured in the Nagpur clashes that broke out between two communities after right-wing outfits held a protest demanding the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb.

Woman kills husband with lover's help, hides chopped up body in cement-filled drumA Meerut woman, Muskan Rastogi, and her lover Sahil were arrested for murdering her husband, Saurabh Rajput, chopping off his body, and hiding it in a cement-filled drum.

Watch: Dolphins are the surprise welcome crew for Sunita WilliamsDolphins greeted the Crew-9 astronauts as they splashed down in the Gulf Coast of Florida after a 17-hour-long journey from space. The Crew-9 mission includes Nasa astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who have been in space for nine months.

Is Humanities still considered the poor cousin of Science in India? A 2019 survey on career awareness amongst Indian students found that 93% of those aged 14 to 21 knew only about seven career options across different streams, despite India offering over 250 job roles.
Did Putin keep Trump waiting for an hour to discuss ceasefire? Video sparks buzzVladimir Putin reportedly kept Donald Trump waiting for an hour before their Ukraine ceasefire call.

Indian Green Card holders face deportation risk: Their rights and recourseGreen Card holders, including Indians, are facing never-before-seen scrutiny as the Trump administration walks the talk on citizenship, immigration and deportation. What are the rights of American Green Card holders, and what legal recourse do they have if they are threatened with deportation?

These 9 destinations have the cheapest hotel rooms, Japan's on the list tooPlanning a budget trip this spring? Guess what—you don't have to limit yourself to India! You can explore places in Vietnam and Thailand on a budget too.

Indians deported, but Trump fields India-born lawyer to argue deportation ActAmid the executive-versus-judiciary battle in the US over deportations, the Donald Trump administration has fielded an India-born advocate to defend the use of the Alien Enemies Act of 1798 to deport illegal immigrants. Abhishek Kambli is a top official at the Department of Justice and grew up in a working-class family of immigrant Indians.

How Treaty of Versailles ended World War 1 but set the stage for World War 2The Treaty of Versailles, which was signed on June 28, 1919, was intended to bring peace following World War I — but instead produced a greater war, World War 2. After Germany was forced to assume sole responsibility for the war, pay enormous reparations, and give up valuable territory such as Alsace-Lorraine, it sowed the seeds for the next War.

Nagpur rioters molested woman cop, shouted provocative slogans, FIR revealsAccording to an FIR in the Nagpur violence case, a group of rioters pulled at a woman officer's uniform and attempted to touch her inappropriately.

Would he have been as successful as he is today? And what would have happened to CSK's legacy?

Char Jam Yatra: Checkout not needed for Bengaluru choke points' package tourFormer Infosys director Mohandas Pai's viral post labelled Bengaluru's traffic as a 'tourism experience' with a 4-day, 3-night itinerary. The 'char jam' satire struck a chord with commuters, highlighting notorious choke points like ORR, Silk Board, and Marathahalli.

What Ganesh Acharya said after court dismissed Tanushree Dutta's #MeToo caseChoreographer Ganesh Acharya opened up about the sexual assault allegations by actor Tanushree Dutta against him and actor Nana Patekar. Acharya, in an interview with us, explained how Dutta's actions caused him distress.

Miss being next to you: Manoj Manchu's sweet birthday wish for father Mohan BabuActor Manoj Manchu has shared the sweetest birthday wish for his father, Mohan Babu. This comes a few months after the pair engaged in a physical fight last year over property dispute.

sports.headline: India vs Maldives, Live: Captain Sunil Chhetri returnsIndia vs Maldives, football Live score: While the anticipation around Sunil Chhetri's international comeback was already high, it was only amped up after the star forward was declared the captain against the Maldives. Chhetri is all set to complete his retirement u-turn in Shillong.

Did not mean to disrespect PSL: Corbin Bosch explains snub decisionCorbin Bosch clarified his decision to withdraw from PSL 2025 to join Mumbai Indians in IPL 2025, citing career prospects and global exposure as key factors.

NBA: Kristaps Porzingis joins elite 900 club as Celtics triumph over NetsBoston Celtics big man Kristaps Porzingis made history on Tuesday, March 18, as he became the 10th player in NBA history to secure 900 career three-pointers and 900 career blocks.

BCCI family policy won't change: Saikia reacts to Virat Kohli complaintThere will be no changes to the stricter SOPs that BCCI brought after the Border-Gavaskar series, said secretary Devajit Saikia on Wednesday, March 19. Saikia reacted to Virat Kohli's recent statements where he expressed dissatisfaction with the new policies.

Virat Kohli's U19 World Cup teammate bags umpire role for IPL 2025Tanmay Srivastava is set to become the first player-turned-umpire in IPL history, to make his officiating debut in IPL 2025 after having previously played in the league for Punjab. After winning the U19 World Cup in 2008 with Virat Kohli, he had completed BCCI's Level 2 course.

It directed the family court to decide the divorce petition by Thursday, March 20.

MI's Pandya 'not concerned' about Suryakumar's form ahead of IPL 2025Hardik Pandya backed Suryakumar Yadav despite poor form ahead of IPL 2025, confident the star batter will deliver for Mumbai Indians when it matters most.

Watch: New Zealand PM joins Kapil Dev, enjoys street cricket with kids in DelhiNew Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon enjoyed a game of gully cricket with Kapil Dev in New Delhi. Former New Zealand cricketer Ross Taylor and spinner Ajaz Patel joined in on the fun.

Jasprit Bumrah's absence will be a big challenge for MI: Mahela JayawardeneMumbai Indians coach Mahela Jayawardene has admitted that Jasrit Bumrah's absence will be a big challenge for his side early on in the season. Bumrah is still recovering from the back injury he suffered during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
